results.title: Sound recording for motion pictures
results.brief_description: Portrays the work of the motion picture soundman in arranging the set and recording acceptable sync-sound on location. Contrasts the advantages of a sound studio and the problems inherent in recording on location. Discusses three major recording problems and their solutions - accoustical treatment of set, choice and placement of microphone, and controlling unwanted noise including electrical hum in recording equipment.

results.title: Soulmate
results.creator_credit: Lincoln Douglas Hiatt, Fair Dinkum and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Motifs of water and innocence lost abound in this short film about a troubled adult, Jordan, who is plagued by an image from childhood of a woman in red. Cast includes David Gray, Kim Trengrove and Timothy Fox. Music by David Bridie.

results.title: Soulcaking at Antrobus
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Every year at Hallwe’en a gang of men from the village of Antrobus in Cheshire perform a traditional play in the pubs and village halls of the neighbourhood. The film shows a performance at the Wheatsheaf, Antrobus on 12th November 1974, and tries to demonstrate what lies behind it

results.title: SOS Galapagos Islands
results.creator_credit: Paul de Roubaix and Les Films du Centaure
results.brief_description: Shows the work being done by the Charles Darwin Foundation to preserve the Galapagos fauna. Shows te turtles, iguanas and some birds and discusses briefly their importance in Darwin’s research leading to his explanation of evolution. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul de Roubaix and Les Films du Centaure

results.title: Soopergoop
results.brief_description: Rodney, a raffish cat, is an actor in an animated TV commercial who proudly reveals the process of promoting ‘Soopergoop’, a new breakfast cereal. The commercial aims and selling techniques which are used are revealed in a most amusing manner. Shows how children are exploited by appealing to their desires and how they are manipulated to persuade their parents to buy the fictitious breakfast cereal “Soopergoop”. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels

results.title: Sons of the Anzacs 1939-1945
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian War Memorial
results.brief_description: Shows scenes of the Australian forces in the principal campaigns of World War II, from the Middle East to New Guinea and the Pacific, with special reference to Tobruk and the Kokoda Trail. Includes archival footage and newsreels.

results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Songs to remember
results.brief_description: A collection of late 1940s songs with nostalgic visuals of the “good old times” and big band music. Songs include ‘Take me out to the ballgame’ (Men and Maids of Melody), ‘The sidewalks of New York’ (Michael Bartlett) and ‘In the good old summertime’ (Men and Maids of Melody).

results.title: Songs of the range
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: Country and western songs performed by some cowboys and a band including: “When its springtime in the Rockies” featuring Carson Robison and his Buckaroos “The Singing hills” featuring the Arthur Johnston Singers “Git along little pony” featuring the Wakely Trio.
